Paris region inaugurates its first cable car
subhed: The C1 cable car line opened on December 13, connecting the south-eastern Paris suburbs of Créteil and Villeneuve-Saint-Georges. This new mode of urban transport is attracting the interest of many local governments.

Belarus frees protest leader Kolesnikova, Nobel winner Bialiatski in US-brokered deal
subhed: Rights groups, relatives and state media reported 123 people were freed, including foreign citizens, after a US envoy said that Washington was lifting some sanctions on Minsk.

title: US troops and civilian in Syria killed in IS ambush attack
subhed: Two American troops and a civilian were killed in central Syria on Saturday after an alleged member of the Islamic State group opened fire on a joint US-Syrian patrol, officials said. Donald Trump promised retaliation.

title: Sant Ambroeus brings Italian flair to Paris's Latin Quarter
subhed: The New York café-restaurant frequented by celebrities has opened a new location in the elegant Saint-Germain-des-Prés district, offering an Italian-American menu in an atmosphere inspired by the 1930s.

title: 'La Cage aux Folles': Paris reclaims the flamboyant musical
subhed: French audiences mostly know 'La Cage aux Folles' from the film adaptation of Jean Poiret's play, featuring Michel Serrault's exuberant performance. But it is also a triumphant Broadway classic, freed from clichés about homosexuality. Now, director Olivier Py and actor Laurent Lafitte bring the musical to the Théâtre du Châtelet in Paris.

Paris Agreement: Ten years later, key players look back on 'incredible alignment of stars'
subhed: Le Monde takes a look back at the the signing of the Paris Agreement in the French capital on December 12, 2015, a major geopolitical agreement reached after two weeks of intense negotiations that aimed to limit global warming to 'well below' 2°C and at 'pursuing efforts' to keep the temperature increase to 1.5°C.

title: The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
subhed: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.

title: Ukraine ready to consider Donbas demilitarized zone in concession to end war
byline: By Philippe Ricard and Claire Gatinois
subhed: Mykhailo Podolyak, an advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, tells Le Monde that the zone would require Ukrainian and Russian forces to both pull back from the front line.
